revised_title: Invention of a Thermometer for Measuring High Degrees of Heat
tldr: Josiah Wedgwood attempts to create a thermometer for measuring high degrees of heat, from a red heat to the strongest that clay vessels can withstand. He experiments with different materials and methods, eventually developing a clay-based thermometer that measures heat through the contraction of the material when exposed to fire. This invention would be useful for various industries and scientific experiments.
